result.execSummary:
The defendant Markese K. Tibbs was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery with Use of Force [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Co-Deft Moreno-Arroyo 14CF364 paid the restitution in full

**AS OF 8-3-15  -  NEW RESTITUTION AMOUNT DUE JOINT/SEVERALLY WITH CO-DEFTS.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.  
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  
*  Submit to a DNA sample (unless previously provided) and pay surcharge.  
*  Pay restitution plus surcharges.  State to submit restitution order.  Joint & severally with 14CF364 & 14cf365.   
May not have contact with felons, victims, co-deft Montriel Solomon, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  
*  Issue of restitution for victim John S held open for 1 year pending surgery.

Extended Supervision Conditions-ordered by the court

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney T Rose.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Court imposes a total sentence of 5 years WSP; 3 years initial confinement with credit for 240 days served; 2 years extended supervision w/conditions; deft is eligible for CIP/SAP; deft to submit DNA sample and pay $250 DNA surcharge; restitution ordered in the amount of $567.54 (by stipulation of deft) joint & several with 14CF364 & 14CF365; the issue of restitution for victim John S is held open for a period of one year.  State to submit restitution order.
Bail/Bond - Revoked

Exhibits 1-15, 18 & 19, 21 & 22, 24, 29, 31, and 33 inventoried and stored in Br 1 under 14CF365.
Guilty.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney T Rose.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Jury finds deft guilty.  Court polls jury.  Juror's excused at 2:34pm.  Court enters judgment on verdict.  PSI ordered.  SEH 12/11/14 at 11am.  Bond revoked.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney T Rose.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Day 2.  Testimony taken from:  KPD Detective Jason Kenesie.  State rests.  Atty Rose moves to dismiss.  Court denies motion for reasons set forth on the record.  Defense rests.  Jury instructions given.  Closing arguments.  Alternate juror is #3911, excused at 12:23pm.  Jurors deliberate at 12:25pm.   Verdicts reached at 2:16pm.
Stipulation of Markese Tibbs received 10/28/14

Defendant Markese K. Tibbs appeared with Attorney Terry William Rose with assistant Tamara Weathersby.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Carli A. McNeill appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk: N. Jurgens. 
MINUTES: Voir Dire began at 1:53 pm; completed at 3:27 pm. Extra jurors released at 3:50. Jurors sworn; opening instructions given to the jurors by The Court. Jurors released for the day at 4:22 and instructed to return at 8:30 am on 10-28-2014.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney T Rose.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  State files amended information.  Atty Rose acknowledges receipt and waives reading.  Preliminary motions held.  Witnesses are sequestered, with exception of KPD Detective Jason Kenesie.  JS to begin at 1:15pm.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney T Rose.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Parties stipulate to admission of video.  Atty Rose's motion to select jury from another county is denied.  Case remains set for trial; issue of ID of deft to be addressed prior to trial.  Bond continued.

JSH set for 10/20/14 at 1:15pm; State's proposed redactions to be addressed at this time.  Court finds good cause to not meet guidelines for speedy trial demand for reasons set forth on the record.  Bond continued.
